results.title: 100 Years of Victorian women's right to vote
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Australian women have long been at the forefront of political change and civic reform. Over the decades, women have fought for their beliefs; the right to vote, professional advancement; and equality under the law. Watch the inspirational stories of eight women who were all first in their respective fields in this biographical documentary project. Produced by ACMI in partnership with the Victorian Government, through the Office of Women’s Policy Department of Planning and Community Development as part of the 2008 Celebration of the Centenary of Women’s Vote.

results.title: Lecki Ord
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Lecki Ord has an extensive career of community involvement and town planning and is a veteran campaigner for sustainable living. She has long been leading the way for women entering fields dominated predominantly by men since starting out as an architect in the 1960s. In 1987 Ord became the first female Lord Mayor of Melbourne and in 1995 became a founding member of the Women’s Planning Network.
results.description: Lecki Ord has an extensive career of community involvement and town planning and is a veteran campaigner for sustainable living. results.title: Judy Maddigan
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.
results.description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.

results.title: Dur-e Dara
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.
results.description: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.

Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.

results.title: [Yoram Gross Films film posters]
results.brief_description: Reproductions of posters for Yoram Gross animated films: “Art Alive” ; “The Adventures of Blinky Bill” ; “Blinky Bill’s Extraordinary Adventures” ; “Flipper & Lopaka” ; “Old Tom” ; “Samuel & Nina” ; “Skippy” ; “Tabaluga” ; “Dot and the Kangaroo” ; “Epic” ; “Joseph the Dreamer” ; “The Seventh Match” ; “The Camel Boy” ; “The Little Convict” ; “The Magic Riddle” ; “Blinky Bill’s White Christmas”.

results.title: Yoram Gross interview collection
results.brief_description:
Contains:
1.’Channel 9 News’ item: Blinky Bill
2. ‘TVTV’ program (Sept. 1993): Yoram Gross, Blinky Bill, Guy Cross, Robyn Moore, Robert Smit
3. ‘7.30 Report’ ABC: Keith Scott, Yoram Gross, Blinky BIll, Dot and the whale, Guy Cross
4. Dot & Kangaroo, Athol Henry, Animators, Dot goes to Hollywood
5. Guy Cross Film music
6. ‘Channel 7 News’ and ‘A Current Affair’ (June 1994): Blinky Bill versus Senator McGaurin
7. Ray Martin interviews Yoram Gross, Dot and Keeto
8. ‘Small Business Show’ Channel 9: Yoram Gross interview, Sandra Gross interview
9. News article on the Childrens Film Festival
10. Childrens Film Festival interview with Yoram Gross
11. Channel 9 News: Childrens Film Festival, Bob Hawke, Guy Cross
12 ‘Today Show’ Channel 9: Interview with Yoram Gross, Around the World with Dot
13. ‘Today Show’ Channel 9 (May 1985): Interview with Yoram Gross, Epic (poor image quality)
14. ‘C’mon Kids’: making Dot & Keeto with Athol Henry
15. ‘11am’ Channel 7: Dot & Keeto, Around the World with Dot, Dot Goes to Hollywood, Sarah
16. ‘Tutti’ SBS: Blinky Bill, Sarah, Bandstand
17. ‘Midday with Derryn Hinch’: Robyn Moore interview

results.title: Blinky Bill production featurette
results.brief_description: Documentary capturing the production process behind the creation of a Blinky Bill animated film. Includes storyboard and cel animation, sound recording, filming live action footage, creating models, music composition and sound recording.Yoram Gross, John Palmer (writer), Frank Hammond (cinematographer), Ray Nowland (art director), Guy Gross (composer) and other crew are also featured discussing their work.
